byline.contributor: Pam Belluck and Catherine Saint Louis contributed reporting.

abstract: Researcher Michael J LaCour, UCLA political science scholar under fire for misrepresenting data regarding same-sex marriage study published in journal Science, defends assertion that gay canvassers can affect respondents' attitudes on issue.
lead_paragraph: Michael J. LaCour apologized for misrepresenting some aspects of the study about the effect gay canvassers can have in changing people’s minds about same-sex marriage.

headline.main: Study Using Gay Canvassers Erred in Methods, Not Results, Author Says
headline.print_headline: Author Apologizes for Lies About Same-Sex Marriage Study, but Defends Finding

snippet: Michael J. LaCour apologized for misrepresenting some aspects of the study about the effect gay canvassers can have in changing people’s minds about same-sex marriage.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
